question.content:
Use the graph below to answer the following question.

**Public trust in government**
![](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/944ea7b952f01ffd1712043591fe2f0e7f55c77f.png)

>Source: [Pew Research Center](http://www.people-press.org/2017/05/03/public-trust-in-government-1958-2017/#chart)

**Which of the following accurately describes a trend of public trust in the federal government from 1958 to 2017?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

choices.clue: Based on the moving average from multiple polls the decline is clearly evident in the graph.
choices.content: Public trust has generally declined, rising briefly during periods of economic growth and the 9/11 crisis

choices.clue: The moving average generally shows smaller variations in public trust over time than does the line plotted from individual polls.
choices.content: The moving average of trust levels has had greater variations than the trust levels derived from individual polls

choices.clue: The public trust dropped during the Vietnam war era of the Johnson and Nixon administrations as well as during the invasion of Iraq during G.W. Bush’s tenure.
choices.content: Public trust has increased during wartime administrations when the nation’s citizens have rallied around the president

choices.clue: There are notable exceptions to this generalization, including the Nixon, Ford, Clinton, and both Bush presidencies.
choices.content: Public trust has declined during Democratic presidencies and has risen during Republican administrations
